text: Heat transfer by convection in a liquid is due to the

options.A: Latent heat of vaporization of the liquid
options.B: Increased vibration of the molecules of the liquid about theit mean position
options.C: Variation of density of the liquid
options.D: Expansion of the liquid as it is heated

explanation:
Liquids and gasesexpandwhen they are heated. The liquid or gas in hot areas is less dense than the liquid or gas in cold areas, so it rises into the cold areas.

text: A boy receives the echo of his clap reflected by a nearby hill 0.8s later. How far is he from the hill? [ speed of sound in air = \(340ms^{-1}\)
explanation:
Time for echo both ways = 0.8Therefore time for echo in 1 way = 0.8/2 = 0.4Distance = Speed x timeDistance = 340 x 0.4Distance = 136m

text: The maximum power transfer occur in a cell when the external resistance is

options.A: Twice the internal resistance of the cell
options.B: The same as the internal resistance of the cell
options.C: Greater than the internal resistance of the cell
options.D: Less than the internal resistance of the cell

explanation:
the maximum power transfer theorem states that the maximum power is transferred from a source e.g. cell or battery to its load (external resistance) when the resistance of the load is equal to the internal resistance of the source.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A circuit has a resistance of 200Ω. The resistance of the circuit can be reduced to 120Ω when

options.A: A 300Ω resistor is connected to it in parallel
options.B: An 80Ω resistor is conneceted to it in series
options.C: A 150Ω resistor is connected to it in parallel
options.D: A 240Ω resistor is connected to it in series

explanation:
A 300Ω resistor is connected to it in parallel
Let R\(_t\)  = total resistance in parallel
\(\frac{1}{R_t}\) = \(\frac{1}{R_1}\) + \(\frac{1}{R_2}\) = \(\frac{1}{200}\) + \(\frac{1}{300}\)
R\(_t\)  = \(\frac{200 \times 300}{200 + 300}\) = \(\frac{6000}{500}\) = 120 \(\Omega\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: What is the best method of demagnetizing a steel bar magnet?
explanation:
Solenoid method: This involves placing the magnet inside a solenoid (an electromagnet) and gradually reducing the current. It provides a controlled environment for effective demagnetization.
